intro: Schismatoglottis adoceta, commonly known as the Adoceta arrowroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, fibrous stems and broad, arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Schismatoglottis adoceta is noted for its underground tubers, which are used as a starchy food source in some local communities. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ethnobotanical study.
